info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Perquimans, southeastern Bertie and southern Chowan Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valhalla, or 13 miles north of Plymouth, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Windsor, Hertford, Winfall, Chapanoke, Cape Colony, Snug Harbor, Burgess, Valhalla, Midway, Holiday Island, Saint Johns, Mount Gould, Hancock, Yeopim Station, Jacocks, Beach Springs, Light Nixon Fork, Woodard, Harvey Point and Somerset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
